data.title: The Young Fabians
data.meta_description: The Young Fabians | 664 followers on LinkedIn. We provide space for fresh thinking, for the future of the left. | The Young Fabians are the under 31s section of Britain's oldest left-wing think tank and Labour Party affiliate, the Fabian Society. Since the 1960s, the Young Fabians and our ideas have set the political agenda and changed our country for the better. And as the UK's only think tank run by and for young people, we're yours to join and shape.
data.text:
Please join us at the next event in our training series, this time covering local government! ⏰ 22nd August, 6-7pm 📍 Online ✍️ If you’re a member of the Young Fabians, you should have received an email with signup details, but message us if not!

Please join us at the next event in our training series, this time covering local government! ⏰ 22nd August, 6-7pm 📍 Online ✍️ If you’re a member of the Young Fabians, you should have received an email with signup details, but message us if not!

Good to deliver the keynote speech at last night's The Young Fabians conference where we considered the UK’s role in AI governance. AI has incredible potential to transform lives and public services such as the NHS. We have an incredible tech sector here in the UK but the Government have been too slow to capitalise on opportunity. Of course when it comes to emerging tech like AI regulation will play a central role - but it is possible to regulate without stifling innovation. Managing these risks is crucial as we continue to explore the opportunities AI will afford both now and in the future.

Very excited to have had my article published in the The Young Fabians Quarterly Journal “Anticipations”. The article looks at Camden Council’s approach to supporting young people away from crime through prioritising creating opportunities over punishment. To read my article, and the other excellent submissions, please see the link below. https://lnkd.in/eiziPEsh

Just in time for Labour Party Confernece, the latest edition of Anticipations, the Young Fabians magazine, will be landing on doorsteps! 📖 This issue focuses on criminal justice and you can read it online here: https://lnkd.in/eAXjXhtr

🎉 Our Conference Reception, sponsored by Trainline, is this Sunday! 🎉 Alongside previously announced speakers Tracy Brabin, Mayor of West Yorkshire, Steve Rotheram, Oliver Coppard & Dan Norris, we are delighted to announce Stephen Morgan MP, Shadow Minister of State for Rail will be joining us!🌹 You can join us too & RSVP here ➡️: https://lnkd.in/eDZ6ub3T 📅 Sunday 8th October 2023 🕢 Drinks served from 7.30pm 📍 Revolución de Cuba – Unit 17, Albert Dock, Liverpool L3 4AF (outside secure zone) #Lab23

We're excited to announce that we're hosting this year's fringe event for The Young Fabians, discussing how a Labour government can drive Britain into becoming a Green Growth superpower. We have some great panellists, sharing insights from both local government and the private sector on what our policy platform should look like in power. We can't wait to see you all there! Find out details below, or click the link 👇 https://lnkd.in/eHsGhH9M
